blog.name: thronesdragons
blog.title: Game of Thrones
blog.description: Game of Thrones (GOT) Fans : Pictures, Art, Memes and More!

summary:
[[MORE]] Daenerys Targaryen fan art -

#GameOfThrones #GoT #Daenerys #Khaleesi #JonSnow #GotArt #GameOfThronesArt...
Not-so bold predictions: Starklings FTW
title: Not-so bold predictions: Starklings FTW
body:
This week, I tweeted a ‘Bold prediction’ that tbh wasn’t much of a bold prediction. The basic premise was the Starks come out on top. The tweet read like this:
Bold prediction that I will at some point write a tumblr meta about. Bran gets the NK, Arya kills Daenerys, Sansa takes out Tyrion, and Jon valonqars the sh*t out of Cersei. Just like that all their enemies are gone. #Starks4theWin #Starklings

Bran v’s Night King

This is the point I am the least sure about. But in the end, I do think Bran will play a pivotal role in taking out the Night King and the White Walkers. Jon will come in with the huge assist along with Arya. I fully expect them to have some big kills.

Arya v’s Daenerys

A few other people in the fandom have mentioned this or talked about it. Arya has long been about killing Cersei, the Queen. Except for last season when Lannister soldiers asked her where she was going she said ‘To kill the Queen.’ A great twist to this would be that she eventually kills or plays a huge role in taking out Daenerys. She may come to a place where her skills are better used to protect her family.
I could also see Daenerys being substituted in for Drogon in this case. I would love an Eowyn like moment where Arya takes off whatever face she is wearing and slays the beast. The show even gave us misdirects with the recent Arya staring in awe at dragons footage. 

Sansa v’s Tyrion

This is the point I am most confident about. Sansa really needs to get Tyrion out of the way if she wants to live her life. The show made a bit of a mess of this. However, in the books, she is still very much married to Tyrion. She very much didn’t want to be married to him and still doesn’t. A higher authority could give her an annulment. Except for Jon just made the lovely decision to pledge to Daenerys. And Daenerys would have no interest in annulling a marriage between Tyrion and Sansa. What would better tie the North and the Westerlands to her cause then maintaining this marriage. See when Jon gave up his crown (sorta…he never actually got down on his knee…) he gave up his authority in the North outside of commanding the armies. Sansa has the real power in Winterfell, now. The check on that. The check on Northern independence is Tyrion re-asserting their marriage. So yea Sansa really has to get out of it. This whole scenario may not play out in the show, we may get hints of it instead. Since the show has to end the same as the books, Sansa still has to take out Tyrion, the reasoning just might shift a bit.

**Also, I fully believe Tyrion is the real ‘giant’ Sansa slays in the castle made of snow. Again in the show, she may do it somewhere else. Tyrion is the only character referred to as a giant among men etc. etc. Littlefinger is a red herring for this prophecy imo.

Jon v’s Cersei

As I said in my tweet, I believe Jon will valonqar the shit out of Cersei. I’ve written about this is here and here and here. The basic argument goes a bit like this, the use of the term hints at someone with valyrian ancestry. Or someone who would become known by that term which means people might attribute valyrian ancestry to them. The term also means little sibling or brother. This makes it an ideal term to refer to Jon after the parent reveal because he is the younger of Rhaegar’s children. He is the younger Aegon. The added bonus is he is the younger King in the North, too. This makes more sense in the books where (f)Aegon, Rhaegar’s older son and the older Aegon because Jon will be named Aegon in the books, plays a big role. I mean seriously guys can’t you just see it…Jon will become know as Aegon the Valonqar.

Another point in this theories favor is that Jon is the only character we see get in close and lose his sh*t on people. He punched Ramsey repeatedly and uncontrollably. He choked out Littlefinger. In the books, he is constantly clutching and unclutching his sword hand to the point that it is a nervous habit. He’s just waiting to wrap his hands around someone’s neck.

And what sets him off like this? People who have harmed or mention Sansa. It’s pretty safe to say that Sansa is on the very short list of two of being the younger more beautiful queen. If Cersei threatens her in any way…well…Jon is very likely to lose his mind. This is becoming even more likely because there are serious rumors out there that Cersei kidnaps Sansa. Yes, this theory relates to Jonsa and a possible Jonsa ending but it is not limited to that. 

Generally, the ‘pack’ kills together. They will all help each other take out the various other parties. We’ve already seen this with Jon and Sansa in the BoTB and later when Sansa, Arya, and Bran execute Littlefinger.  But each Starkling takes the lead on one of these end game deaths. There are other noteworthy deaths that our Starks may have a hand in (The Mountain, Euron, etc). But the ones mentioned here are the big ones. The Starks are the center of this story. They are our erstwhile heroes. This story is about them coming into their own. About them perhaps starting a new dynasty. To do that they are going to have to take a few people out first.

blog.name: pierrotdameron
blog.title: "le spleen n'est plus à la mode"
blog.description: His Dark Materials will be the new Game of Thrones // Expect lots of HDM and GOT/ASOIAF (ok more ASOIAF than GOT for obvious reasons // Spider-Man side blog : @TheParkerPapers // GOT music + Ramin Djawadi sideblog @thecomposerthatwaspromised

summary: I really want Jon to ride Rhaegal in S8 because it’ll give an excuse to Ramin to make Jon’s theme shine, we barely heard in S7...
body:
I really want Jon to ride Rhaegal in S8 because it’ll give an excuse to Ramin to make Jon’s theme shine, we barely heard in S7 we were robbed

Also we totally need to have a track named “Song of ice and fire” in the album.

reblog.comment:
I really want Jon to ride Rhaegal in S8 because it’ll give an excuse to Ramin to make Jon’s theme shine, we barely heard in S7 we were robbed

Also we totally need to have a track named “Song of ice and fire” in the album.

I really want Jon to ride Rhaegal in S8 because it’ll give an excuse to Ramin to make Jon’s theme shine, we barely heard in S7 we were robbed

Also we totally need to have a track named “Song of ice and fire” in the album.

tags: yup...I understand got was inspired by lotr
I'm just saying I love this!!!
//there's probably more stuff too... this is all I could think of
//I'll probably make a gifset exploring their similarities one day
summary: Aragorn is a Stark Arwen is a Targaryen You can't change my mind. I mean, call me crazy... but sometimes it feels like...
body:
Aragorn is a Stark

Arwen is a Targaryen

You can’t change my mind.

I mean, call me crazy… but sometimes it feels like Aragorn/Jon and Arwen/Daenerys are the same people……

I’m about to spill the tea, child.

Aragorn - heir to Isildur; rightful King of Gondor and Arnor

Jon - heir to Aegon the Conqueror; rightful King of the Seven Kingdoms

Aragorn - hidden identity

Jon - hidden identity

In love with family relation: Arwen - distant cousins

In love with family relation: Daenerys - aunt/nephew

Band of Brothers:

Aragorn - Dúnedain/Rangers of the North

Jon - Night’s Watch

Taken in by family after one or both parents died

Aragorn - taken in by Elrond (distant uncle), and raised as his own in Rivendell

Jon - taken in by Ned (uncle), and raised as his own in Winterfell

Aragorn - raised in Rivendell

Jon - raised in Winterfell

Close animal companion

Aragorn - Brego

Jon - Ghost

Arwen - Asfaloth

also worth mentioning that Arwen is often connected to her ancestor Lúthien - it is said they bear a striking resemblense to one another and they share similar stories. Lúthien and her mortal lover Beren were often helped and accompanied by the large hound Huan… kind of like a Direwolf, very Stark of them. *wink, wink*

Daenerys - Drogon, Viserion and Rhaegal

Kind and brave

Great warriors

Epic Sword:

Aragorn - Andúril

Jon - Longclaw

Dead mother, who wanted to protect his real identity, even from himself

Origins:

Arwen - Her people originally came from Valinor

Daenerys - Her people originally came from Valyria

Two Older Brothers:

Arwen - Elladan & Elrohir

Daenerys - Rhaegar & Viserys

Royal Blood:

Arwen - descendant of the ancient House of Hador and of King Turgon of the Ñoldor, as well as the granddaughter of Lady Galadriel and the great-granddaughter of Finarfin. She is also the direct niece of Elros Tar-Minyatur, the first King of Númenor

Daenerys - descendant from Aegon the Conqueror, and last living child of the Mad-King Aerys II

Boss-Ass Queens

Silver Queen:

Arwen - despite having her father’s dark hair, her mother’s name - Celebrían - literally means “Silver Queen“, and it’s highly likely that she had silver-gold hair like her own mother Galadriel and silver hair like her father Celeborn

Daenerys - known as the Silver Queen, due to her characteristic Targaryen pale silver-gold hair

What I’m trying to say is… if these two worlds merged, Aragorn would be King in the North and Arwen would be riding Dragons and saying DRACARYS!!!

I’ve always loved the idea of the Arwen as a Targaryen. Sue me.

Also… you can imagine how pumped I was when Liv Tyler (Arwen) and Kit Harington (Jon) recently starred together in the show Gunpowder…

Arwen - descendant of the ancient House of Hador and of King Turgon of the Ñoldor, as well as the granddaughter of Lady Galadriel and the great-granddaughter of Finarfin. She is also the direct niece of Elros Tar-Minyatur, the first King of Númenor

Daenerys - descendant from Aegon the Conqueror, and last living child of the Mad-King Aerys II

Boss-Ass Queens

Silver Queen:

Arwen - despite having her father’s dark hair, her mother’s name - Celebrían - literally means “Silver Queen“, and it’s highly likely that she had silver-gold hair like her own mother Galadriel and silver hair like her father Celeborn

Daenerys - known as the Silver Queen, due to her characteristic Targaryen pale silver-gold hair

What I’m trying to say is… if these two worlds merged, Aragorn would be King in the North and Arwen would be riding Dragons and saying DRACARYS!!!

I’ve always loved the idea of the Arwen as a Targaryen. Sue me.

Also… you can imagine how pumped I was when Liv Tyler (Arwen) and Kit Harington (Jon) recently starred together in the show Gunpowder…
trail.content:
Aragorn is a Stark

Arwen is a Targaryen

You can’t change my mind.

I mean, call me crazy… but sometimes it feels like Aragorn/Jon and Arwen/Daenerys are the same people……

I’m about to spill the tea, child.

Aragorn - heir to Isildur; rightful King of Gondor and Arnor

Jon - heir to Aegon the Conqueror; rightful King of the Seven Kingdoms

Aragorn - hidden identity

Jon - hidden identity

In love with family relation: Arwen - distant cousins

In love with family relation: Daenerys - aunt/nephew

Band of Brothers:

Aragorn - Dúnedain/Rangers of the North

Jon - Night’s Watch

Taken in by family after one or both parents died

Aragorn - taken in by Elrond (distant uncle), and raised as his own in Rivendell

Jon - taken in by Ned (uncle), and raised as his own in Winterfell

Aragorn - raised in Rivendell

Jon - raised in Winterfell

Close animal companion

Aragorn - Brego

Jon - Ghost

Arwen - Asfaloth

also worth mentioning that Arwen is often connected to her ancestor Lúthien - it is said they bear a striking resemblense to one another and they share similar stories. Lúthien and her mortal lover Beren were often helped and accompanied by the large hound Huan… kind of like a Direwolf, very Stark of them. *wink, wink*

Daenerys - Drogon, Viserion and Rhaegal

Kind and brave

Great warriors

Epic Sword:

Aragorn - Andúril

Jon - Longclaw

Dead mother, who wanted to protect his real identity, even from himself

Origins:

Arwen - Her people originally came from Valinor

Daenerys - Her people originally came from Valyria

Two Older Brothers:

Arwen - Elladan & Elrohir

Daenerys - Rhaegar & Viserys

Royal Blood:

Arwen - descendant of the ancient House of Hador and of King Turgon of the Ñoldor, as well as the granddaughter of Lady Galadriel and the great-granddaughter of Finarfin. She is also the direct niece of Elros Tar-Minyatur, the first King of Númenor

Daenerys - descendant from Aegon the Conqueror, and last living child of the Mad-King Aerys II

Boss-Ass Queens

Silver Queen:

Arwen - despite having her father’s dark hair, her mother’s name - Celebrían - literally means “Silver Queen“, and it’s highly likely that she had silver-gold hair like her own mother Galadriel and silver hair like her father Celeborn

Daenerys - known as the Silver Queen, due to her characteristic Targaryen pale silver-gold hair

What I’m trying to say is… if these two worlds merged, Aragorn would be King in the North and Arwen would be riding Dragons and saying DRACARYS!!!

I’ve always loved the idea of the Arwen as a Targaryen. Sue me.

Also… you can imagine how pumped I was when Liv Tyler (Arwen) and Kit Harington (Jon) recently starred together in the show Gunpowder…

summary: Now Jon has a different favorite sister, so
question: Now Jon has a different favorite sister, so
answer:
HAHAHAHAHAHAAHAHAHAAHAHHA

Who Did Jon Die For? Arya.

Who Did Jon Compare His Lovers To? Arya.

Who Did Jon Call His “Home.”? Arya.

Who Did Jon Miss The Most? Arya.

Who Does Jon Remember As His Closest Friend And Fondest Memory? Arya.

Who Did Jon Call “My Heart.”? Arya.

Who Does Jon Think About In EVERY Chapter? Arya.

Who Did Jon Commit Treason By Becoming A Deserter For? Arya.

Who Does Jon Remember As Being A Bully? Sansa

Who Does Jon Have Bad Memories Of? Sansa.

Try again my darling, your desperation is showing.

summary: Jon Snow
body:
Jon Snow

Let’s stop saying Jon Snow is dumb. I’m guilty of it. I’ll admit he does dumb shit. Because he’d rather be brave than smart. And maybe he assumes that because he’s honorable, everyone else will be too. But he isn’t an idiot. He’s actually pretty bright and capable. He can lead. Yeah he gets in his own way with his honor and decency and hero complex, but doing stupid things and being a stupid person are two different things. I think he does learn from his mistakes and the mistakes of others.

body:
Guys you know how history repeats itself in a way;

Ned refused to help Robert kill Daenerys, the last known Targaryen heir.

Now we see Jon refusing to allow Daenerys to hurt Gendry, the last known Baratheon heir.

summary:
I can't wait to see how Arya reacts to...
Being asked to bow down to Daenerys
On the one hand, she doesn't care about sitting on...
body:
I can’t wait to see how Arya reacts to…

Being asked to bow down to Daenerys

On the one hand, she doesn’t care about sitting on any throne. On the other, with half of her family dead, she’s beginning to grasp the importance of the few remaining Starks holding Winterfell. She might not care about titles, but she is a proud Northener. Ned and her years South have made her such. I wonder how she’d feel giving up the North to a foreigner. Her conversation with Tywin shows she has a positive view of Aegon’s sisters. But she was a child then and the Targaryens were just a tale. Now she’ll have to come face to face with one.

Finally seeing Jon again

Arya loves Jon the most of all her siblings. Their goodbye in the beginning of the story shows just how special they are to each other. But with both of them having grown and suffered, with Jon having been killed once and Arya having killed many times, they’re different people now. I wonder if the dynamics between them could change. On the one hand, all pain was forgotten when Jon and Sansa met again, and I saw Arya being her lighthearted self with Brienne. But on the other, they are all in a much darker place now, and there might be no time for more than just a quick hug and a short smile.

Meeting Gendry once more

He kept her dangerous secret safe. He’s someone whose life she saved. They ran together, were captured together, escaped together. On the one hand, she considered him family. On the other, he told her he didn’t feel the same. Even so she resents Melisandre for having taken him away. But even if Melisandre didn’t, she knows he would’ve left her anyway. Does Arya unknowingly hold a grudge? Did her reunion with “Jaqen” remove Gendry from whatever place he once held in her heart? How will Gendry’s friendship with Jon affect the way he sees her? How will it affect the way she sees him?

I guess Season 8 to me is less “What will happen to everyone?” and more “How will Arya deal with everyone?”.

I hope she somehow gets to kill my other favorite, Cersei. But before she does, I hope they get to know each other just a tiny bit better.

blog.name: survivor-reborn
blog.title: Sunlight, sunlight, sunlight.
blog.description: Jo. Witch, wren, Stark, writer. 'Death is not the end. You're not a lamb. You're far more resilient than that.' 'Power is transient.' Header was a gift from @jobean12-blog

summary: you know Jon is afraid of fathering a bastard, but Jon and Sansa parallel Ned/Cat... what if he 'fathers' a 'bastard' anyway......
body: you know Jon is afraid of fathering a bastard, but Jon and Sansa parallel Ned/Cat… what if he ‘fathers’ a 'bastard’ anyway… and it’s Robb’s son? Like. Jeyne is still alive and pregnant in the books. if she gave birth technically the child is a bastard bc his father was killed. and Jon could take him in (we’ve seen him offer to take on Gilly’s son, in Castle Black, and raise him as his own child) so like. idk. like Robb made Jon his heir. Maybe he’ll take on his son.

Maybe he’ll take on his son.
